about.title: About Me
about.subtitle: Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering Student
about.p1: I'm an engineering student at Kyushu University (IUPE) with a passion for structural dynamics and vibration analysis. My academic journey began at age 14, when I discovered Computer-Aided Design (CAD) through tools like FreeCAD. I was immediately drawn to the precision, scalability, and creative potential CAD offers—especially in the field of engineering.
about.p2: My interest deepened during my participation in the Physics Olympiad, where I developed a strong enthusiasm for mechanics and logical problem-solving. This led me to explore how computational tools and CAD skills could be combined to solve complex mechanical problems using methods like the Finite Element Method (FEM).
about.p3: I'm particularly driven by the often-overlooked importance of structural dynamics in modern engineering design. Neglecting dynamic behavior in structures can lead to critical issues in real-world applications. That's why I'm passionate about advancing tools and technologies that help engineers better understand and integrate dynamic analysis into their designs—especially in energy systems and upstream machinery.
